title.rendered: Find Rooms for Rent in Oklahoma City

content.rendered:
Are you thinking about trading in the chaos of a big city for the tranquility and comfort of a small town? If so, then we might have the perfect place for you – Oklahoma City! With a cosmopolitan crowd and a small-town charm, Oklahoma City is the best of both worlds. It also just so happens to be one of the best cities for first-time home buyers. So, whether you’re looking for cheap rooms for rent in Oklahoma City or looking to buy, you’ve come to the right place. From the top neighborhoods to the average rent in Oklahoma City, we’ve got all the information you need right here!

So, strap in, cowboys (and girls), we’re taking you for a ride!

Related: 15 Best Things To Do In Oklahoma City

Getting to know Oklahoma City

Oklahoma City is one of the best cities to live in for those looking to buy a house and settle down. A city with a fascinating history and a booming economy, it’s no surprise that so many people have decided to make this city their home over the past few years. Even if you’re not looking to buy property right now, finding cheap rooms for rent in Oklahoma City shouldn’t be too difficult, as the average rent here is pretty reasonable.

While the summers here can be a bit hot, Oklahoma City is one of the few lucky cities in America that gets to properly witness all four seasons. And trust us, once you experience the quintessential southern hospitality here, you will never want to live anywhere else. So with that, let’s look at some of the best neighborhoods to live in once you join us over in “The Big Friendly” – called so because of the welcoming residents!

Finding rooms for rent in Oklahoma City

Find A Room For Rent In Oklahoma City

While Oklahoma City is well known for being a favorite amongst home buyers, there’s a lot of great options for renters too. The average rent in Oklahoma City is well below the national average, making it a great option for youngsters. But just because you can easily find cheap rooms for rent in Oklahoma City doesn’t mean that the quality of housing is bad. It’s anything but. Here’s a look at the top neighborhoods around here!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Tulsa

Top neighborhoods in Oklahoma City

  • Bricktown: This is the heart and soul of Oklahoma City. Known as the Entertainment District, this neighborhood is great for anyone who wants to live in the most lively area of the city. The crowd here largely consists of youngsters, so finding cheap rooms for rent in this part of Oklahoma City should be easy. Plus, you’ll never have a dull moment living here.
  • Nichols Hills: This neighborhood is for anyone who wants to live in a beautiful and quaint neighborhood. With gorgeous houses all around, the average rent in this neighborhood of Oklahoma City is on the higher side. But if you’re willing to spend the extra money, it’s so totally worth it!
  • Edmond: Edmond is a great neighborhood for families and young, free spirits alike. It’s got some great schools around for the kids and some great restaurants and cafes for the young adults. The average rent here is pretty reasonable, so finding cheap rooms for rent in Edmond, Oklahoma City should be easy. Especially when you have Roomi helping out!

Average rent in Oklahoma City

University life in Oklahoma City

Oklahoma City is a fantastic place for college students. With the bustling art scene, the rich history, and the amazing music festivals, there’s something here for every student. Plus, finding cheap rooms for rent in Oklahoma City is very easy, which means you get to save money on accommodation! Now, that’s not something you get to say a lot as a student! The cost of living in Oklahoma City is lower than the national average, but the quality of living is extremely high. Trust us, if you come to Oklahoma City for college, you’ll have the time of your life. And to make your search a little easier, here are the top five universities around here!

Top five universities in Oklahoma City:

  • University of Oklahoma
  • Oklahoma City University
  • Oklahoma State University
  • University of Central Oklahoma
  • Oklahoma Christian University

How transit-friendly is Oklahoma City?

One thing you should know about Oklahoma City is that most people drive around here. It was once called the least walkable city in America. While things are better now, it’s best to have your own car if you’re going to be living here. But of course, there are some other great modes of transportation here as well. Let’s take a look!

1. Walkability

While things are improving around here in terms of walkability, the walk score of Oklahoma City is still 34. This means that for most of your day-to-day errands, you’re going to have to drive. But the good news is that the city is becoming more and more walker-friendly by the day!

2. Roads/traffic

While Oklahoma City is pretty car-reliant, driving around here is surprisingly pleasant. In fact, Oklahoma City is the sixth most drivable city in the United States. Additionally, the city is positioned right at the crossroads of I-35, I-40, and I-44, making it extremely accessible for everyone.

3. Taxis

Taxi services are available in Oklahoma City, especially around the airport. Of course, Uber and Lyft are always at your disposal. Another option you have here is getting a rental car if you’re in town for a few days.

4. Public transportation

The Central Oklahoma Transportation and Parking Authority (COTPA) or EMBARK are responsible for public transportation in Oklahoma City. They have plenty of options for you such as EMBARK Ferry Transit, EMBARK Bike Share (Spokies), OKC Streetcar, and EMBARK Parking. You won’t have trouble finding your way around town with all these services at your disposal!

5. Airports in Oklahoma City

There are three airports in and around Oklahoma City:

  • Will Rogers World Airport
  • Clarence E. Page Airport
  • Wiley Post Airport

6. Cycling in Oklahoma City

There are some pretty fantastic biking trails in Oklahoma City. From the Lightning Creek Trail to the West River Trail, there’s a lot to see. And you can even take advantage of the city’s EMBARK Bike Share program. Here’s some more information on bike trails in Oklahoma City.

Related: 15 Best Things To Do In Oklahoma City

Historical sites in Oklahoma City

If you’ve ever been to Oklahoma City, you know that the city seeps in grand history and culture. If you haven’t been here before, then we have some suggestions for you. Don’t miss these while you’re here; the following historical sites are an integral part of the city’s charm.

  • Oklahoma City National Memorial & Museum
  • Henry Overholser Mansion
  • Chickasaw Bricktown Ballpark
  • National Stockyard Exchange
  • St. Joseph Old Cathedral
  • Harn Homestead

Cultural activities in Oklahoma City

Oklahoma City is one of the most vibrant cities in the United States. With a lively art and music scene, there’s not a single night where the city is dull.  There’s plenty of festivals all year round that you can go to – some that you might even discover impromptu. But here’s a list of festivals we recommend to everyone living in or visiting Oklahoma City:

  • Paseo Arts Festival
  • Deadcenter Film Festival
  • The Festival of the Arts
  • Chuck Wagon Festival
  • An Affair of the Heart
  • Red Earth Festival

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Oklahoma City? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
